pullRequest.title: chore(dockerfile): add arg for jdk tag
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
I was quite annoyed on debugging that I have to reinstall all the time the jdk and dbg symbols. This solves quite easy via an dockerfile arg.
Example to get JDK image:
docker build --build-arg DISTBALL=dist/target/zeebe-distribution-*.tar.gz --build-arg JDK_TAG=11 -t gcr.io/zeebe-io/zeebe:zell-docker-jdk .

Example default:
docker build --build-arg DISTBALL=dist/target/zeebe-distribution-*.tar.gz -t gcr.io/zeebe-io/zeebe:zell-docker-jre .


Pull Request Checklist

 All commit messages match our commit message guidelines
 The submitting code follows our code style
 If submitting code, please run mvn clean install -DskipTests locally before committing

nodes.bodyText: Can we make that actually for the base image name, so we can eventually test with different distros? e.g. BASE_IMAGE or JDK_IMAGE or APP_IMAGE or anything.

-FROM openjdk:11-jre-slim as app
+FROM openjdk:${JDK_TAG} as app

commit.message:
chore(dockerfile): add stage to build dev image

 Add stage build to decided wether prod or dev image should be build. Can be done via --build-arg APP_ENV=dev
